text: William Awihilima Kahaiali'i, known as Willie K, (1961 - May 19, 2020) was an American singer-songwriter, musician and record producer. His music genres were blues, rock, Hawaiian, and opera. He was born in Lahaina, Maui. In 1993, Willie began to work with Amy Hānaialiʻi Gilliom that would last for nine years. They recorded, performed, and toured together, and also shared a personal relationship. Their recordings won seven Na Hoku Hanohano Awards. In 2005, Willie's reunion album with Gilliom, Amy & Willie Live, was nominated for a Grammy in the first year of the Best Hawaiian Music Album award. In February 2018, Willie K was diagnosed with lung cancer. In April 2019, Willie announced that it was terminal. He died a month later on 19 May 2020, aged 59. ==References== ==Other websites== *Official site Category:1961 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Deaths from lung cancer Category:American singer-songwriters Category:American record producers Category:American rock singers Category:American blues singers Category:American blues musicians Category:American rock guitarists Category:Musicians from Hawaii Category:Singers from Hawaii
title: Willie K
